intro: Jamesbrittenia lyperioides, commonly known as the lyperoid dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
